alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Koolau Windward; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Olomana; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued January 11 at 3:40PM HST until January 13 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR THE NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY MORNING FOR ALL HAWAIIAN ISLANDS... .A northwest (320 degrees) and north (350 degree) swell will arrive and pass through the region through Saturday, with both swells peaking at high end advisory levels for smaller islands on Friday. Additional wave run-up is possible during the early morning high tides over the next couple of days due to higher than predicted tides. This will likely produce minor to localized moderate coastal flooding both Friday and Saturday mornings. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST SATURDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, surf peaking at 18 to 24 feet along north facing shores, 10 to 15 feet along west facing shores. For the Coastal Flood Statement, minor to localized moderate low lying coastal flooding during times of high tide. * WHERE...For the High Surf Advisory, north and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu and Molokai, and for the north facing shores of Maui. For the Coastal Flood Statement, any low lying flood prone coastal location. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 6 AM HST Saturday. For the Coastal Flood Statement, through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Flooding of beaches that are normally dry, minor coastal erosion, and saltwater inundation. Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous. Submit your coastal flooding photos to the University of Hawaii Sea Grant College Program`s Hawaii and Pacific Islands King Tides Project at: PacificIslandsKingTides.org
info.instruction: Avoid driving through flooded roadways. If you are forced to drive through salt water, be sure to rinse your vehicle with fresh water. Move electronics, vehicles or other valuables to higher ground. Monitor vessels to ensure mooring lines don`t get too tight and watch out for overwash around boat ramps. Secure canoes or other watercraft stowed on beaches. Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
